measurableElement.name: Drinking Water is tested and chlorinated
The facility receives adequate quantity of water as per requirement
There is storage tank for the water and tank is cleaned periodically
Bed-sheets and pillow cover are stain free and clean
The facility has adequate stock (including reserve) of linen
Bed-sheets and linen are changed daily
Medical officers monitor cleanliness and hygiene of outreach sessions and sub centres.
ASHA's are promoting cleanliness and hygiene practices
Biomedical waste generated during outreach session are transported to the PHC on the same day
Security personal reprimands attendants, who found indulging into unhygienic behaviour - spitting, open field urination & defecation, etc.
Departments are locked after working hours
One Security Guard per shift
Bio medical waste Management training has been provided to the staff
PHC has documented Standard Operating procedures for Cleanliness, Bio-Medical waste management and Infection Control
Infection control Training has been provided to the staff
Cleanliness and infection control committee has representation of all cadre of staff including Group ‘D’ and cleanings staff
Roles and responsibility of different staff members have been assigned and communicated
PHC leadership review the progress of the cleanliness drive on weekly basis
The Health facility has a system to take feed-back from patients and visitors for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility
Local community and organisations are involved in monitoring and promoting cleanliness
Patients are made aware of their responsibility of keeping the health facility clean
IEC regarding importance of maintaining hand hygiene is displayed in PHC premises
IEC regarding use of toilets is displayed within PHC premises
IEC regarding Swachhta Abhiyan is displayed within the facilities’ premises
PHC has dress code policy for all cadre of staff
There is a regular monitoring of hygiene of staff
Identity cards and name plates have been provided to all staff
Use of energy efficient bulbs
Adequate illumination in inside and outside of the PHC area
No water logging in open areas
There is no abandoned / dilapidated building / unused structure within the premises
No junk material within PHC premises
PHC has demarcated space for keeping condemned junk material
Walls are well-plastered and painted
Name of the PHC is prominently displayed at the entrance and have uniform signage system
Check if the facility has rain-water harvesting system
Water supply system is maintained in the PHC
No stray animals within the facility premises
Pest Control Measures are implemented in the facility
The Staff periodically sorts useful and unnecessary articles at work station
The Staff arranges the useful articles, records in systematic manner and label them
Front area/ Parks/ Open spaces are well maintained
Internal Roads and pathways are uneven and clean
PHC has intact boundary wall and functional gates at entry
PHC Infrastructure is well maintained
Patients' furniture is in good condition
Window and doors are maintained
No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Garbage in Toilets
Toilets have running water and functional cistern
Ambulatory area are cleaned at least once in the day with wet mop
No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation on walls and roof in Auxiliary area
Availability of Detergent Disinfectant solution / Hospital Grade Phenyl for Cleaning purpose
Availability of Cleaning Equipment
No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Vegetation/ Dust on the walls and roof in the Circulation area
Corridors are cleaned at least once in the day with wet mop
Procedure area are cleaned at least twice in a day
No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ vegetation's on walls and roof in Procedure area
Lab and Pharmacy area are cleaned at least once in the day with wet mop
No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ Vegetation on walls and roof in Lab and Pharmacy area
Periodic Monitoring of Housekeeping activities
Use of Housekeeping Checklist
No blocked/ over-flowing drains in the facility
Availability of connection with Municipal Sewage System/ or Soak Pit
Use of Three bucket system for cleaning
Use unidirectional method and out word mopping
No dirt/Grease/Stains and Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/ Vegetation's on walls and roof in OPD
OPD are cleaned at least two in a day with wet mop
Segregation of BMW is done as per BMW management rule,2016
Check if the staff is aware of segregation protocols
The waste is transported in closed bag & trolley
The PHC's waste is collected and transported by CWTF operator
Availability of Mercury Spill Management Kit and Staff is aware of Mercury Spill management
Disposal of hazardous chemicals
Dedicated Storage facility is available for biomedical waste
No Biomedical waste is stored for more than 48 Hours
Liquid waste is made safe before mixing with other waste water
The laboratory has a functional protocol for managing discarded samples
Disposal of General Waste
Innovations in managing general waste
Availability of Bins and plastic bags for segregation of waste at point of use
Availability of Needle/ Hub cutter and puncture proof boxes
PHC has a valid authorization for Bio Medical waste Management from the prescribed authority
PHC maintains records, as required under the Biomedical Waste Rules 2016
Sharp Waste is stored in Puncture proof containers
Disinfection of Broken / Discarded Glassware is done as per recommended procedure
PHC has adequate facility for disposal of Biomedical waste
Facility manages recyclable waste as per approved procedure
Staff is adheres to hand washing protocol
Availability of Sink and running water at point of use
Decontamination of instruments and Surfaces like examination table, dressing tables etc.
Staff knows how to make Chlorine solution
Antibiotic Policy is implemented at the facility
Immunization and medical check-up of Service Providers
Facility measures the Health care associated infections
Facility reports all notifiable diseases and events
Adherence to Protocol for High Level disinfection
Adherence to Protocols for sterilization
Staff is aware of how to manage spills
Spill management protocols are displayed at points if use
Cross-ventilation
Preventive measures for air borne infections has been taken
Use of Masks ,Head cap and Lab coat, Apron etc.
Use of Gloves during procedures and examination
Staff is aware about Standard Precautions
Infectious patients are separated from other patients
No re-use of disposable personal protective equipment
The staff is aware of use of gloves, when to use (occasion) and its type
Arrangements for washing linens
Available linens are clean
Medicines are arranged systematically
Cold storage equipment's are clean and managed properly
Presence of security Guard
Departments are locked after working hours
The facility receives adequate quantity of water as per requirement
There is storage tank for the water and tank is cleaned periodically
Biomedical waste generated during outreach session are transported to the PHC on the same day
Medical officers monitor cleanliness and hygiene of outreach sessions and sub centres.
IEC regarding Swachhta Abhiyan is displayed within the facilities’ premises
IEC regarding importance of Hygiene practices are displayed
Roles and responsibility of different staff members have been assigned and communicated
Cleanliness and infection control committee has been constituted
There is a regular monitoring of hygiene of staff
PHC has dress code policy for all cadre of staff
Bio medical waste Management training has been provided to the staff
Infection control Training has been provided to the staff
Patients are made aware of their responsibility of keeping the health facility clean
The Health facility has a system to take feed-back from patients and visitors for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility
The facility provides Reproductive health Services
The facility provides Newborn health Services
The facility provides Maternal health Services
The facility Provides Laboratory Services
Services are available for the time period as mandated
There is established procedures for taking informed consent before treatment and procedures
Information about the treatment is shared with patients or attendants, regularly
Patients & visitors are sensitised and educated through appropriate IEC / BCC approaches
The facility has uniform and user-friendly signage system
The facility displays the services and entitlements available in its departments
Information is available in local language and easy to understand
The facility ensures the behaviours of staff is dignified and respectful, while delivering the services
Adequate visual privacy is provided at every point of care
The facility ensures privacy and confidentiality to every patient, especially of those conditions having social stigma, and also safeguards vulnerable groups
Confidentiality of patients records and clinical information is maintained
Services are provided in manner that are sensitive to gender
Access to facility is provided without any physical barrier & and friendly to people with disabilities
The facility has adequate nursing staff as per service provision and work load
The facility has adequate specialist doctors as per service provision
The facility has adequate support / general staff
The facility has adequate general duty doctors as per service provision and work load
The Staff is provided training as per defined core competencies and training plan
Competence assessment of Clinical and Para clinical staff is done on predefined criteria at least once in a year
There is established procedure for utilization of skills gained thought trainings by on -job supportive supervision
Availability of equipment and instruments for resuscitation of patients and for providing intensive and critical care to patients
Availability of Equipment for Storage
Availability of functional equipment and instruments for support services
Availability of equipment & instruments for treatment procedures, being undertaken in the facility
Availability of equipment & instruments for diagnostic procedures being undertaken in the facility
Availability of equipment & instruments for examination & monitoring of patients
Departments have patient furniture and fixtures as per load and service provision
Service counters are available as per patient load
Patient amenities are provide as per patient load
The facility and departments are planned to ensure structure follows the function/processes (Structure commensurate with the function of the hospital)
Departments have layout and demarcated areas as per functions
Departments have adequate space as per patient or work load
The facility has infrastructure for intramural and extramural communication
The facility has adequate circulation area and open spaces according to need and local law
The facility has adequate fire fighting Equipment
The facility has a system of periodic training of staff and conducts mock drills regularly for fire and other disaster situation
The facility has plan for prevention of fire
The facility ensures safety of electrical establishment
The facility ensures the seismic safety of the infrastructure
Physical condition of buildings are safe for providing patient care
Emergency drug trays are maintained at every point of care, where ever it may be needed
The departments have adequate consumables at point of use
The departments have availability of adequate drugs at point of use
The facility ensures adequate power backup in all patient care areas as per load
The facility has adequate arrangement storage and supply for portable water in all functional areas
Critical areas of the facility ensures availability of oxygen, medical gases and vacuum supply
Operating and maintenance instructions are available with the users of equipment
The facility has established system for maintenance of critical Equipment
The facility has established procedure for internal and external calibration of measuring Equipment
The facility ensures the adherence to dress code as mandated by its administration / the health department
The facility has a established procedure for duty roster and deputation to different departments
The facility ensures safe and comfortable environment for patients and service providers
The facility has established measure for safety and security of female staff
The facility has provision of restriction of visitors in patient areas
The facility has security system in place at patient care areas
The facility provides adequate illumination level at patient care areas
The facility has standard procedures for handling , collection, transportation and washing of linen
The facility has adequate sets of linen
There is established procedure for forecasting and indenting drugs and consumables
The facility ensures proper storage of drugs and consumables
There is process for storage of vaccines and other drugs, requiring controlled temperature
There is a procedure for periodically replenishing the drugs in patient care areas
The facility ensures management of expiry and near expiry drugs
The facility has established procedure for inventory management techniques
Hospital infrastructure is adequately maintained
Exterior & Interior of the facility building is maintained appropriately
The facility has policy of removal of condemned junk material
The facility has established procedures for pest, rodent and animal control
Patient care areas are clean and hygienic
